page.title: 01Slaggyford and Knarsdale
page.content: To the east of the lock,the south Tyne Valley runs from North to South,and through it passes the main Alston- Brampton road and the Alston Holtwhistle railway, now disused (closed 1976). The village of Slggyford and the hamlet of Knarsdale are built in the v alley on the river terraces above the haugh. Slaggyford has a population of about 100, and Knrsdale of about 30. To west of these hamlets many arms occupy low ells around knar Burn and Thinhope Burn. In the extreme west, Black Hill and Glendue Fell rise to nearly 500 meters. Fells are open, part heather, part rough grass, used for sheep grazing and grouse shooting. Valley farms raise cattle and sheep and crop the haughs for hay.
